resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

bkietz commented on pull request #6480: ARROW-7929: [C++] Align CMake target names to upstreams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6480#discussion_r383337377
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/gandiva/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -28,7 +28,7 @@ add_dependencies(gandiva-all gandiva gandiva-tests gandiva-benchmarks)
 if(ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE STREQUAL "CONDA")
   set(LLVM_ROOT $ENV{CONDA_PREFIX})
 endif()
-find_package(LLVM)
+find_package(LLVM MODULE)
 
 Review comment:
   Why was this added? So that `cpp/cmake_modules/FindLLVM.cmake` will be used even if `-DCMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_PREFER_CONFIG=ON` is specified? In any case, please add a comment describing why this option is set
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on pull request #6480: ARROW-7929: [C++] Align CMake target names to upstreams
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6480#discussion_r383829215
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/gandiva/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -28,7 +28,7 @@ add_dependencies(gandiva-all gandiva gandiva-tests gandiva-benchmarks)
 if(ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE STREQUAL "CONDA")
   set(LLVM_ROOT $ENV{CONDA_PREFIX})
 endif()
-find_package(LLVM)
+find_package(LLVM MODULE)
 
 Review comment:
   Please explicitly mention our custom `FindLLVM.cmake` and the fact that it will override `-DCMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_PREFER_CONFIG=ON` (it's something of which users may not be aware, so this is a potentially surprising gotcha for the next person who uses that option)

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Configuring a build tree with the flag {code:sh}-DCMAKE_FIND_PACKAGE_PREFER_CONFIG=ON{code} fails, because some of the targets exposed from the provided Find* modules differ from the upstream names.
Namely this is the case for the targets of GTest, GLog and Thrift.
fields.summary: [C++] CMake target names differ from upstream provided names
